description: Triangle read by rows; row 0 is 0; the n-th row for n>0 contains the coefficients in the expansion of (1-x)*(1+x)^(n-1).
comments: The greatest term in the row n is reached when k is the nearest integer to (n - sqrt(n+1))/2. When n is one less than a square, and consequently this formula gives a half-integer, the maximum is reached twice. - _Ivan Neretin_, Apr 26 2016
references: A. A. Kirillov, Variations on the triangular theme, Amer. Math. Soc. Transl., (2), Vol. 169, 1995, pp. 43-73, see p. 71.

formula: T(n, k) = T(n-1, k-1)+T(n-1, k); T(0, 0)=0, T(1, 0)=1, T(1, 1)=-1.T(n, k) = C(n, k)-C(n, k-1) where C = binomial coefficient A007318.G.f.: (1-y) / (1-x-x*y). - _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 23 2005T(n,k) = binomial(n-1,k)-binomial(n-1,k-1), for n>=k. T(n,k)=0, for n<k. T(n,k) = sum_{i=-k..k} (-1)^i*binomial(n-1,k+i)*binomial(n+1,k-i), for n>0. Row sums are 0. - _Mircea Merca_, Apr 28 2012a(n) = -A008482(n). - _Michael Somos_, May 24 2015Sum of positive terms of the row n is the central binomial coefficient A001405(n-1).- _Ivan Neretin_, Apr 26 2016
